titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Peter K. Olitsky papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA184

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-03-07 00:22:16 -0500.

did.unittitle: Peter K. Olitsky papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Peter Kosciusko Olitsky, 1886-1964, pathologist and microbiologist at The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, 1917-1964. An outstanding virologist and investigator of epidemic diseases of bacterial, viral and rickettsial nature.

eventgrp.event: Born August 20, New York, New York
Internship (Hospital later absorbed by St. Marks Hospital)
New York City Health Department Research Laboratory
Eugene Meyer Fellowship in Pathology, Pathology Laboratory, Mt. Sinai Hospital, New York
Assistant, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, New York, N.Y.
Closed laboratory Worked as consultant and advisor with Howard Schneider on experimental allergic encephalomyelitis (EAE)
Died July 20, Greenwich Hospital, Greenwich, Conn.
U.S. Army Commission on Neurotropic Virus Diseases
WHO/FAO Panel on zoonoses, United Nations, Geneva Associate Editor, Journal of Immunology

bioghist.p: Member of: New York Academy of Medicine (Fellow), American Association of Immunologists, Harvey society, Society for Exp. Biology and Medicine, Sigma Xi

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Papers, correspondence, photographs, reprints, and employment record.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: A collection of Peter K. Olitsky Papers, consisting of 2500 pieces is to be found at The American Philosophical Society, Philadelphia.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted pending permission from Rockefeller University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes statement on his work written in 1948 at the request of H.S. Gasser.

did.unittitle: Correspondence regarding presentation to RIMR of portrait of PKO at his retirement from his associates

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes holograph drafts of letters of thanks.

did.unittitle: Correspondence dealing with arrangements at closing of laboratory
Reprint of S. Gard 1954 Nobel Prize presentation quoting Olitsky work on neurotropic virus
Reprint of Report of the Foot-and-Mouth-Disease Commission of the U.S. Department of Agriculture

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily of co-workers. Some of PKO. Anslow, R.; Boes; Canti, R.G.; Casals, J.; Cox, H.R.; Forsbock, F.C.; Harford; Gates, F.L.; Kligler; Knutti; Larsen, S.; Lee J.M.; Muller, L.; Long; Morgan; Plotz, H.; Saenz; Straub, E.L.; Syverton, J.; Tal (Max child); Theiler, Max; Yager; Welch, W.H.

did.unittitle: Fishing trip: Parker, Cox, Kaa, Humble, Olitsky
Strasbourg; Hong Kong; RIMR; Hoof and Mouth Disease

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes delayed birth registration.

did.unittitle: Framed pencil drawing made by stepdaughter, Louise Tubby Bracken about 1956. Given by W. Goebel
Oral history (1917-1952) transcript. Interviews by Saul Benison, 1962-63. 91 pp. Indexed

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes birthday greetings from wife [n.d.]; August 1946 letters from associates on 60th birthday. Letters dealing with health of various family members including daughter, Ruth, and stepson Roger Tubby; a few family letters from nephew H. Sparrow, Louise Sparrow, B. Carpenter and granddaughter, Susue; letters regarding estate of Louis Olden. Thank you letter from daughter Louise Phillips and correspondence with stepson Roger Tubby. Copies of poems composed by PKO on various laboratory occasions.

did.unittitle: Obituary materials collected on various associates by PKO for use in his own writing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes material on P. Boez, 1888-1930; on Simon Flexner including biographical article written for Collier's Encyclopedia with 1960 correspondence; biographical article on Frederick L. Gates and 1950, 1952, 1954 correspondence with Dorothy Elsmith, widow of F.L. Gates, and also with daughter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily official announcements though includes renewals of allowances for supplies and some specialized items.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondents include: C.H. Andrewes ; C.H. Archetti ; Alberto Ascoli ; Gilbert Dalldorf ; Brig. Gen. G.M. Findlay ; Jordi Folch ; Jules Freund ; Chas. L. Goldman ; Joan Fitzgerald Golrick; A. Grumback ; Frank L. Horsfall ; Martin M. Kaplan; Hilary Koprowski; C.L. Le Bouvier; Henryk Makower ; A. Saenz; Kenneth C. Smithburn; Isabel Morgan Mountain; Maria Rudzinska; Madge Stein; Maurizio Terni; Rudolph Wittkower; Ralph W.G. Wyckoff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Items of special interest are listed below this level.

did.unittitle: With John R. Paul and Brig. Gen. S. Bayne-Jones on publication of "Certain affections of the liver that arise spontaneously in so-called Normal stock albino mice." Under Commission on Neurotropic Virus Diseases

With John R. Paul on publication of "Enduring Immunity following vaccination of mice with Formalin-inactivated virus of Russian Spring-Summer (Far Eastern, Tick borne) encephalitis..." Under Commission on Neurotropic Virus Diseases
With David Bodian on "MV" strain of polio virus and monkey immune serum
With Harold K. Faber and A. Sabin work on mechanism of infection in post tonsillectomy bulbar polio

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Items of special interest are listed below this level.

did.unittitle: On dinner in honor of J. Bronfenbrenner
With J. Folch-Pi on Waksman (et al) abstract in Fed. Proc. no. 1526

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Items of special interest are listed below this level.

did.unittitle: Copy of letter from A.B. Sabin to Hilary Koprowski with holograph note to PKO
From M.S. Shahan on retirement of Jacob Traum
With Jules Freund (holographs) on diagnosis of multiple myeloma and his state of health
With George W. Corner on history of RI
With John H. Dingle on statement regarding etiology of the common cold. Olitsky refers to work of A.B. Sabin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Items of special interest are listed below this level.

did.unittitle: With A.A. Hoehling requesting that PKO write an introduction to book for laymen on 1918 influenza epidemic

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes holograph note from James P. Leake, and history note from PKO to E. Kone.

did.unittitle: From Philip Levine on difficulties in writing an address on Karl Landsteiner
To George S. Mirick recommending Labe C. Scheinberg for Health Research Council Fellowship

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order where there are more than 25 items for each correspondent. Chronological within folder.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also Joan Fitzgerald Golrick's letters from Washington, D.C. describing the work going on in the Army Medical Veterinary Division with Major Anslow.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An involved group of letters dealing with interest in a theory of fundamental particles proposed by Mr. Avery and attempts by PKO to aid in its publication.
Includes copies of letters from John A. Wheeler, Princeton University; A. Einstein; George A. Baitsell; Alexandre Rothen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Some holograph letters and reports from Dr. Brown and one signed typescript from Jonas Salk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Several holograph letters; 2 from Japan while at 406th Medical General Laboratory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes two Simon Flexner reprints: 1920, 1937. On mementos and correspondence relating to S. Flexner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copies of letters written from Strasbourg on Hoof and Mouth Disease Project.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Many holograph letters written during times of illness. Letters reporting experimental results while PKO away from laboratory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes letter to PKO (1963 Apr. 30) explaining background to T. River's remarks to Saul Benison about A. Sabin's attitude on Schlesinger's work on dengue and sandfly fevers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains references to H. Bernkoff, Col. Yager.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes reprint from British Journal of Experimental Pathology, 2 April. 1958.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 1942 July 15 signed letter from Albert Sabin and copy of 1942 Nov. 24 letter from A. Sabin on efficacy of allantoic fluid vaccine and potency when stored.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Chap. 23: Avian encephalomyelitis by Henry van Roekel and Chap. 27: Foot and Mouth Disease by Harry Schoening including holograph letter 7 Jan. 1957 on his retirement and request to pass on to Dr. Shahan the authorship of the chapter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1942 and later revisions of Section II: "Infections of man with the virus of equine encephalomyelitis".

did.unittitle: Viral and Rickettsial Infection in Man

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copies of Chap. 13 and 14, 3rd ed. mss. 1951-1959.
Includes correspondence with Frank Horsfall and others.

Includes some correspondence on 2nd. ed. under editorship of T. Rivers 1951-1952 including letters from A. Sabin, 22 May 1951; K. Smithburn 19 Mar. 1951; J. Melnick 22 Mar. 1951; Joe Smadel, holograph 12 April 1951.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists primarily of the correspondence with directors and business managers during the period of Dr. Olitsky's association with The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research.
Included is the original application for employment and many handwritten letters from Dr. Olitsky in response to increased salary letters.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Received or inventoried June, 1980. This box (5 folders) of papers was deposited by the Office of Faculty and Student Records.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged by subject and in chronological order.

did.unittitle: Correspondence and blueprints for remodeling and air duct arrangement in Olitsky laboratory
Correspondence from the lay public with various ideas about polio which Peter Olitsky answered
Signed releases for those vaccinated and working in the Olitsky laboratory with equine encephalitis virus

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wm Trager to RUA (9/15/82) [in black case].
